title: 114_hr4387
content: The Act is titled the "Tule Lake National Historic Site Establishment Act of 2016" and includes definitions. SEC. 2. DEFINITIONS. This section defines key terms such as Historic Site, Map, Monument, Secretary, State, Airport, County, and City in relation to the Tule Lake National Historic Site Establishment Act of 2016. SEC. 3. Tule Lake National Historic Site. Establishment of the Tule Lake National Historic Site in the State to preserve the historic site of incarceration and segregation of Japanese Americans during World War II. Boundaries of the site are depicted on a map available for public inspection. The Secretary will administer the site in accordance with this Act and laws applicable to National Park System units. The Director of the National Park Service and the Director of the United States Fish and Wildlife Service will enter an agreement for the management of resources within the Tule Lake National Wildlife Refuge. The National Park Service will manage and interpret the Historic Site within the refuge boundaries. The Secretary may use resources from Lava Beds National Monument to administer the Historic Site. A general management plan must be prepared within 3 years, in coordination with Tule Lake National Wildlife Refuge. When preparing the general management plan for the Historic Site, the Secretary must consult with the City, County, and Airport to ensure that the site's management does not negatively impact airport operations. SEC. 4. Removal of Tule Lake Unit from the World War II Valor in the Pacific National Monument. The boundaries of the Monument are revised to exclude the Tule Lake Unit, incorporating it into the Historic Site. Any funds for the excluded land will be used for the Historic Site. References to the Tule Lake Unit in official documents will be updated. The Tule Lake Unit is excluded from the World War II Valor in the Pacific National Monument and incorporated into the Tule Lake National Historic Site. References to the Tule Lake Unit in official documents will be updated accordingly. SEC. 5. The President and Secretary must consult with County and City and obtain written approval before designating or acquiring lands for the Historic Site. SEC. 6. No buffer zones will be created outside the park, and activities outside the park will not be restricted based on visibility or noise within the park.
